com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class AssemblerInput.Properties

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.AssemblerInput.Properties
  • Enclosing class:
    AssemblerInput

    public static final class AssemblerInput.Properties
extends Object
    Some properties that briefly summarise what the input will look like. This allows the assembler to provide options that take into account that data without needing to actually load all the data first.

      • getNumberOfPairedSequences

        public long getNumberOfPairedSequences()
        Returns:
        the number of sequences which are paired with another sequence. Since each sequence is counted, this returns twice the number of pairs.

      • setNumberOfPairedSequences

        public void setNumberOfPairedSequences(long numberOfPairedSequences)
        Sets the number of sequences which are paired with another sequence.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPairedSequences - the number of sequences which are paired with another sequence. Since each sequence is counted, this should be twice the number of pairs.

      • getNumberOfSequencesWithQuality

        public long getNumberOfSequencesWithQuality()
        Returns:
        the number of sequences (excluding any reference sequences) which have quality (i.e. return true from NucleotideGraph.hasSequenceQualities()

      • setReferenceSequences

        public void setReferenceSequences(List<AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence> referenceSequences)
        Sets reference sequences currently selected by the user in the options.
        Parameters:
        referenceSequences - the reference sequences currently selected by the user in the options. Must not be null but may be an empty list.
        Since:
        API 4.51 (Geneious 5.5.1)

      • getReferenceSequences

        public List<AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence> getReferenceSequences()
        Returns the reference sequences currently selected by the user in the options. Will not be null but may be an empty list (for de novo assemblers). Be careful using this method. It may take time to load the actual sequences (via AssemblerInput.ReferenceSequence.getSequenceDocument(jebl.util.ProgressListener) so this should not be done from the swing thread.
        Returns:
        the reference sequences currently selected by the user in the options.
        Since:
        API 4.51 (Geneious 5.5.1)

      • getReferenceSequencesLength

        public long getReferenceSequencesLength()
        Returns:
        the total length of all reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        See Also:
        getMaximumReferenceSequenceLength()

      • setLengthOfReferenceSequences

        @Deprecated
public void setLengthOfReferenceSequences(long lengthOfReferenceSequences)
        Deprecated. use setLengthOfReferenceSequences(long, long) instead
        Sets the total length of all reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        Parameters:
        lengthOfReferenceSequences - the total length of all reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.

      • setLengthOfReferenceSequences

        public void setLengthOfReferenceSequences(long totalLengthOfReferenceSequences,
                                 long maxReferenceSequenceLength)
        Sets the total length of all reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        Parameters:
        totalLengthOfReferenceSequences - the total length of all reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        maxReferenceSequenceLength - the maximum length of any of the reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • getMaximumReferenceSequenceLength

        public long getMaximumReferenceSequenceLength()
        Returns:
        the maximum length of any of the reference sequences or 0 if there are no reference sequences.
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
        See Also:
        getReferenceSequencesLength()

      • setSingleInputContig

        public void setSingleInputContig(boolean inputIsSingleContig)
        Sets if there is just a single contig being provided as input to the assembler. See isSingleInputContig()
        Parameters:
        inputIsSingleContig - true if there is just a single contig being provided as input to the assembler.
        Since:
        API 4.30 (Geneious 5.3.0)
        See Also:
        ()

      • isSingleInputContig

        public boolean isSingleInputContig()
        returns true if there is just a single contig being provided as input to the assembler. Assemblers which return false from Assembler.supportsSingleInputContig() need not handle this case.
        Returns:
        true if there is just a single contig being provided as input to the assembler.
        Since:
        API 4.30 (Geneious 5.3.0)

      • setAnyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig

        public void setAnyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig(boolean anyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig)
        Sets if there are any reference sequences which are from an undissolved contig.
        Parameters:
        anyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig - true if there are any reference sequences which are from an undissolved contig. In other words at some point one of the assembly reads will be a contig which returns a non-negative value from AssemblerInput.Read.getIndexOfAssemblyReferenceSequenceForContig()
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
        See Also:
        isAnyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig()

      • isAnyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig

        public boolean isAnyReferenceSequenceFromAnUndissolvedContig()
        Returns:
        true if there are any reference sequences which are from an undissolved contig. In other words at some point one of the assembly reads will be a contig which returns a non-negative value from AssemblerInput.Read.getIndexOfAssemblyReferenceSequenceForContig()
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • addChangeListener

        public void addChangeListener(SimpleListener listener)
        Adds a listener to be notified when the values of any properties change.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to be notified.

      • setProperties

        public void setProperties(AssemblerInput.Properties propertiesToCopy)
        Assigns values to all properties by copying them from the given properties. All change listeners (added using addChangeListener(org.virion.jam.util.SimpleListener) are fired by this method.
        Parameters:
        propertiesToCopy - the properties to copy values from.

        Overrides:

        public void setSingleContigMappingToReferenceSequenceFromSeparateDocument(boolean singleContigMappingToReferenceSequenceFromSeparateDocument)
        Sets the result of isSingleContigMappingToReferenceSequenceFromSeparateDocument()
        Since:
        API 4.710 (Geneious 7.1.0)

      • isSingleContigMappingToReferenceSequenceFromSeparateDocument

        public boolean isSingleContigMappingToReferenceSequenceFromSeparateDocument()
        Returns:
        true if the user is not disolving input contigs and they are mapping just a single contig to the reference sequence(s).
        Since:
        API 4.710 (Geneious 7.1.0)
